reference.shortdesc: The refsyn element is a special section inside a reference topic. The section often contains syntax or signature content (for example, the calling syntax for a command-line utility or an API signature). The refsyn contains a brief, possibly diagrammatic description of the subject's interface or high-level structure.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The refsyn element is specialized from the section element in the topic module.

fig.title: Reference topic for software material
fig.codeblock: <reference id="MyAPI"> <title>MyAPI</title> <refbody> <refsyn>Describe the MyAPI syntax here, possibly using synph or syntax elements markup for explicit definition of syntax or prototype construction.</refsyn> </refbody> </reference>
